definitions.definition: the action or process of writing computer programs.
the action or process of scheduling something, especially radio or television programs.
radio or television programs that are scheduled or broadcast.
examples: the station is to expand its late-night programming

definitions.definition: provide (a computer or other machine) with coded instructions for the automatic performance of a particular task.
examples: it is a simple matter to program the computer to recognize such symbols
I've programmed for 25 years and have used many languages

definitions.definition: input (instructions for the automatic performance of a task) into a computer or other machine.
cause (a person or animal) to behave in a predetermined way.
examples: all members of a particular species are programmed to build nests in the same way

definitions.definition: arrange according to a plan or schedule.
examples: we learn how to program our own lives consciously
the next stage of the treaty is programmed for 1996
the station does not program enough contemporary works
